012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.polyglot;
013
014import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
015
016/**
017 * An empty class that only carries {@link SQLAction SQLAction} annotations to
018 * set up the main PL/Java dispatcher functions and (meta)"language".
019 *<p>
020 * Naturally, these will eventually be automated as part of
021 * {@code CREATE EXTENSION pljava}, but for now, they are just here.
022 */
023@SQLAction(provides="pljavahandler language", install={
024"DO LANGUAGE plpgsql '" +
025" DECLARE" +
026"  qbin text;" +
027" BEGIN" +
028"  SELECT quote_literal(probin) INTO STRICT qbin FROM pg_proc" +
029"   WHERE oid = ''sqlj.java_call_handler()''::regprocedure;" +
030"  EXECUTE ''" +
031"   CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchValidator(pg_catalog.oid)" +
032"    RETURNS pg_catalog.void" +
033"    LANGUAGE C AS '' || qbin || '', ''''pljavaDispatchValidator''''" +
034"  '';" +
035"  EXECUTE ''" +
036"   CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchValidator()" +
037"    RETURNS pg_catalog.language_handler" +
038"    LANGUAGE C AS '' || qbin || '', ''''pljavaDispatchValidator''''" +
039"  '';" +
040"  EXECUTE ''" +
041"   CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchRoutine()" +
042"    RETURNS pg_catalog.language_handler" +
043"    LANGUAGE C AS '' || qbin || '', ''''pljavaDispatchRoutine''''" +
044"  '';" +
045"  EXECUTE ''" +
046"   CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchInline(pg_catalog.internal)" +
047"    RETURNS pg_catalog.void" +
048"    LANGUAGE C AS '' || qbin || '', ''''pljavaDispatchInline''''" +
049"  '';" +
050"END'",
051
052"COMMENT ON FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchValidator(oid) IS " +
053"'The validator function for the \"PL/Java handler\" language (in which one " +
054"can only write functions that are validators of actual procedural languages " +
055"implemented atop PL/Java).'",
056
057"COMMENT ON FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchValidator() IS " +
058"'The call handler for the \"PL/Java handler\" language (in which one " +
059"can only write functions that are validators of actual procedural languages " +
060"implemented atop PL/Java). The C entry point is the same as for the " +
061"validator handler, which works because the only functions that can be " +
062"written in this \"language\" are validators.'",
063
064"COMMENT ON FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchRoutine() IS " +
065"'The call handler that must be named (as HANDLER) in CREATE LANGUAGE for " +
066"a procedural language implemented atop PL/Java. (PostgreSQL requires every " +
067"CREATE LANGUAGE to include HANDLER, but PL/Java allows a language to " +
068"simply not implement the Routines interface, if it is only intended for " +
069"InlineBlocks.)'",
070
071"COMMENT ON FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchInline(pg_catalog.internal) IS " +
072"'The handler that must be named (as INLINE) in CREATE LANGUAGE for " +
073"a procedural language implemented atop PL/Java, if that language is " +
074"intended to support inline code blocks.'",
075
076"CREATE LANGUAGE pljavahandler" +
077" HANDLER sqlj.pljavaDispatchValidator" +
078" VALIDATOR sqlj.pljavaDispatchValidator",
079
080"COMMENT ON LANGUAGE pljavahandler IS " +
081"'The PL/Java \"handler language\", used in implementing other procedural " +
082"languages atop PL/Java. Only one kind of function can be written in this " +
083"\"language\", namely, a validator function, and the AS string of such a " +
084"validator function is simply the name of a Java class that must implement " +
085"one or both of PLJavaBasedLanguage.Routines or " +
086"PLJavaBasedLanguage.InlineBlocks, and that class will be used as the " +
087"implementation of the new language.'"
088}, remove={
089"DROP LANGUAGE pljavahandler",
090"DROP FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchInline(internal)",
091"DROP FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchRoutine()",
092"DROP FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchValidator()",
093"DROP FUNCTION sqlj.pljavaDispatchValidator(oid)"
094})
095public abstract class DispatcherSQL
096{
097}
